input_text:
Ethereum: A Next-Generation Smart Contract and Decentralized Application Platform
Vitalik Buterin
vbuterin@ethereum.org

Abstract

Satoshi Nakamoto's development of Bitcoin in 2009 has often been hailed as a radical development in money and currency, being the first example of a digital asset which simultaneously has no backing or "intrinsic value" and no centralized issuer or controller. However, another, arguably more important, part of the Bitcoin experiment is the underlying blockchain technology as a tool of distributed consensus, and attention is rapidly starting to shift to this other aspect of Bitcoin. Commonly cited alternative applications of blockchain technology include using on-blockchain digital assets to represent custom currencies and financial instruments ("colored coins"), the ownership of an underlying physical device ("smart property"), non-fungible assets such as domain names ("Namecoin"), as well as more complex applications involving having digital assets being directly controlled by a piece of code implementing arbitrary rules ("smart contracts") or even blockchain-based "decentralized autonomous organizations" (DAOs). What Ethereum intends to provide is a blockchain with a built-in fully fledged Turing-complete programming language that can be used to create "contracts" that can be used to encode arbitrary state transition functions, allowing users to create any of the systems described above, as well as many others that we have not yet imagined, simply by writing up the logic in a few lines of code.

Introduction

The intent of Ethereum is to merge together and improve upon the concepts of scripting, altcoins, and on-chain meta-protocols, and allow developers to create arbitrary consensus-based applications that have the scalability, standardization, feature-completeness, ease of development, and interoperability offered by these different paradigms all at the same time. Ethereum does this by building what is essentially the ultimate abstract foundational layer: a blockchain with a built-in Turing-complete programming language, allowing anyone to write smart contracts and decentralized applications where they can create their own arbitrary rules for ownership, transaction formats, and state transition functions. A bare-bones version of Namecoin can be written in two lines of code, and other protocols like currencies and reputation systems can be built in under twenty. Smart contracts, cryptographic "boxes" that contain value and only unlock it if certain conditions are met, can also be built on top of our platform, with vastly more power than that offered by Bitcoin scripting because of the added powers of Turing-completeness, value-awareness, blockchain-awareness, and state.
full_prompt:
Summarize the following text in plain English. Focus ONLY on the main idea and key points.
Write a concise summary of 2-3 short sentences. Be extremely brief and direct.
Avoid all unnecessary words, explanations, and details.

Text:
Ethereum: A Next-Generation Smart Contract and Decentralized Application Platform
Vitalik Buterin
vbuterin@ethereum.org

Abstract

Satoshi Nakamoto's development of Bitcoin in 2009 has often been hailed as a radical development in money and currency, being the first example of a digital asset which simultaneously has no backing or "intrinsic value" and no centralized issuer or controller. However, another, arguably more important, part of the Bitcoin experiment is the underlying blockchain technology as a tool of distributed consensus, and attention is rapidly starting to shift to this other aspect of Bitcoin. Commonly cited alternative applications of blockchain technology include using on-blockchain digital assets to represent custom currencies and financial instruments ("colored coins"), the ownership of an underlying physical device ("smart property"), non-fungible assets such as domain names ("Namecoin"), as well as more complex applications involving having digital assets being directly controlled by a piece of code implementing arbitrary rules ("smart contracts") or even blockchain-based "decentralized autonomous organizations" (DAOs). What Ethereum intends to provide is a blockchain with a built-in fully fledged Turing-complete programming language that can be used to create "contracts" that can be used to encode arbitrary state transition functions, allowing users to create any of the systems described above, as well as many others that we have not yet imagined, simply by writing up the logic in a few lines of code.

Introduction

The intent of Ethereum is to merge together and improve upon the concepts of scripting, altcoins, and on-chain meta-protocols, and allow developers to create arbitrary consensus-based applications that have the scalability, standardization, feature-completeness, ease of development, and interoperability offered by these different paradigms all at the same time. Ethereum does this by building what is essentially the ultimate abstract foundational layer: a blockchain with a built-in Turing-complete programming language, allowing anyone to write smart contracts and decentralized applications where they can create their own arbitrary rules for ownership, transaction formats, and state transition functions. A bare-bones version of Namecoin can be written in two lines of code, and other protocols like currencies and reputation systems can be built in under twenty. Smart contracts, cryptographic "boxes" that contain value and only unlock it if certain conditions are met, can also be built on top of our platform, with vastly more power than that offered by Bitcoin scripting because of the added powers of Turing-completeness, value-awareness, blockchain-awareness, and state.

Summary:

responses.amazon.titan-text-premier-v1:0: Ethereum is a platform for decentralized applications and smart contracts. It combines the concepts of scripting, altcoins, and on-chain meta-protocols. It allows developers to create consensus-based applications with scalability, standardization, feature-completeness, ease of development, and interoperability. Ethereum offers a Turing-complete programming language, allowing for the creation of smart contracts and decentralized applications. It also supports the creation of Namecoin, currencies, and reputation systems.
responses.amazon.titan-text-lite-v1: Ethereum is a blockchain with a built-in Turing-complete programming language that enables the creation of decentralized applications with custom currencies, smart property, non-fungible assets, and more. It aims to merge scripting, altcoins, and on-chain meta-protocols and provides a scalable, standardized, feature-complete, and interoperable platform for developers. Smart contracts can also be built on top of the platform, with vastly more power than Bitcoin scripting due to the added powers of Turing-completeness, value-awareness, blockchain-awareness, and state.
responses.amazon.titan-text-express-v1: Bitcoin's blockchain technology is gaining attention as a tool for distributed consensus, with alternative applications such as digital assets, smart property, non-fungible assets, and decentralized autonomous organizations (DAOs). Ethereum aims to merge scripting, altcoins, and meta-protocols to create a blockchain with a built-in Turing-complete programming language, allowing users to create arbitrary consensus-based applications with scalability, standardization, feature-completeness, ease of development, and interoperability. This allows for creating custom rules for ownership, transaction formats, and state transition functions, as well as smart contracts with more power than Bitcoin scripting.
responses.anthropic.claude-3-haiku-20240307-v1:0: Ethereum is a blockchain platform that allows developers to create decentralized applications and smart contracts using a built-in programming language. It aims to improve upon the concepts of Bitcoin, altcoins, and on-chain protocols by providing a flexible and powerful platform for building a wide range of consensus-based applications.
responses.anthropic.claude-3-5-sonnet-20240620-v1:: Ethereum is a blockchain platform with a built-in programming language for creating smart contracts and decentralized applications. It aims to improve upon existing blockchain concepts by providing a flexible foundation for developing various consensus-based systems and protocols.
responses.cohere.command-text-v14: Ethereum is designed to improve upon and integrate the best aspects of various paradigms in cryptocurrency, namely scripting, altcoins, and on-chain meta-protocols. It is built on blockchain technology with a Turing-complete programming language, allowing users to create smart contracts, encode their own custom rules for transactions, and build decentralized applications. Ethereum enables the creation of various financial and cryptographic systems, including custom currencies, asset ownership registries, and more complex applications, all with increased speed, scalability, and interoperability compared to previous technologies.
responses.cohere.command-light-text-v14: The text discusses how Ethereum intends to provide a blockchain with a built-in programming language to create "contracts" that can be used to encode arbitrary state transition functions, allowing users to create smart contracts and decentralized applications (DApps) where they can create their own rules for ownership, transaction formats, and state. The abstract aims to highlight Ethereum's potential as a tool for distributed consensus and its next-generation smart contract capabilities compared to Bitcoin. It also introduces the concept of Turing-complete programming.
responses.meta.llama3-70b-instruct-v1:0:
Ethereum is a decentralized application platform that allows developers to create arbitrary consensus-based applications using a blockchain with a built-in Turing-complete programming language.

---

Here is a concise summary:

Ethereum is a decentralized platform that lets developers create custom applications using a blockchain with a built-in programming language.
responses.mistral.mistral-7b-instruct-v0:2: Ethereum is a blockchain platform for creating decentralized applications using a built-in programming language. It allows developers to create smart contracts and decentralized autonomous organizations with arbitrary rules for ownership and transactions. Ethereum provides a scalable, standardized, and feature-complete foundation for creating various applications, including digital assets, smart property, non-fungible assets, and complex systems. Smart contracts on Ethereum can unlock value only if certain conditions are met, offering more power than Bitcoin scripting due to added features like Turing-completeness, value-awareness, and blockchain-awareness.
responses.mistral.mixtral-8x7b-instruct-v0:1: Ethereum is a new platform that allows developers to create applications with their own rules for ownership and state transition. It uses a built-in programming language to create smart contracts and decentralized autonomous organizations. Ethereum aims to improve upon the concepts of scripting, altcoins, and on-chain meta-protocols, and allow developers to create any consensus-based application.
responses.mistral.mistral-large-2402-v1:0: Ethereum is a blockchain-based platform that features a built-in Turing-complete programming language. This allows developers to create a wide range of decentralized applications and smart contracts with custom rules for ownership, transactions, and state transitions. Ethereum aims to improve upon existing concepts by offering scalability, standardization, and interoperability.
responses.mistral.mistral-small-2402-v1:0:
Ethereum is a decentralized application platform that utilizes blockchain technology and a built-in Turing-complete programming language. This allows users to create complex systems called "smart contracts" and "decentralized autonomous organizations" (DAOs), which can represent custom currencies, ownership of physical devices, and more. The Ethereum platform aims to improve upon existing concepts of scripting, altcoins, and on-chain meta-protocols, offering scalability, standardization, and ease of development.

(2-3 sentences)
Ethereum is a blockchain platform with a built-in Turing-complete programming language, enabling users to create complex systems called "smart contracts" and "decentralized autonomous organizations" (DAOs). It aims to improve upon existing concepts of scripting, altcoins, and on-chain meta-protocols, offering scalability, standardization, and ease of development.
